gobblin.config.store.api

Interface ConfigKeyPath

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SingleLinkedListConfigKeyPath

    @Alpha
public interface ConfigKeyPath
    The ConfigKeyPath is used to describe the relative path for a given configuration key URI to the root URI of a config store (ConfigStore.getStoreURI()). For example, for a configuration store with root URI hfs://namenode.grid.company.com:9000/configs/hfs_config_root/ and a config key URI hfs://namenode.grid.company.com:9000/configs/hfs_config_root/data/tracking/, the ConfigKeyPath will be /data/tracking.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConfigKeyPath createChild(String childPathName)
      Creates a path that is a child of the current path by appending one component to the path.
      String getAbsolutePathString()
      The absolute configuration key path.
      String getOwnPathName()
      The last component of this path.
      ConfigKeyPath getParent()
      The path to the parent.
      boolean isRootPath()
      Check if the current path is the root path ("/").

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        ConfigKeyPath getParent()
        The path to the parent.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current node is the root.

      • getOwnPathName

        String getOwnPathName()
        The last component of this path. For example, for /a/b/c, it will return "c". If the current path points to the root ("/"), the result is the empty string "".

      • createChild

        ConfigKeyPath createChild(String childPathName)
        Creates a path that is a child of the current path by appending one component to the path. For example, if the current path points to "/a/b", createChild("c") will return a path that points to "/a/b/c" .

      • getAbsolutePathString

        String getAbsolutePathString()
        The absolute configuration key path. This is joining all path components from the root using "/" as a separator.

      • isRootPath

        boolean isRootPath()
        Check if the current path is the root path ("/").
